website_summaries.verdict: You aren't likely to find a mallet that offers more for such an impressive price. It's built for multiple uses.
pros: This mallet stands out for its dual head that features plastic and rubber-like sides to accommodate different surfaces and materials
cons: Some consumers gripe that this mallet seems larger than expected
The head isn't quite as flexible as on traditional rubber mallets

customer_reviews.title: Good tool to have
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast. When I was look at this hammer, I really thought it was going to be the size of the small brass hammers for gun smithing. This hammer is much bigger but I like it. The two ends come off and I guess you can put other types on but I have not seen any on Amazon. The hammer appears to be heavy duty and the handle has a rubber to help out with holding/grip.
customer_reviews.author: Matt C

customer_reviews.title: Unscrew The Ends And Put LocTite On Them
customer_reviews.text: Medium duty mallet not for heavy pounding. The rubber/plastic ends are very similar in hardness. As many others have pointed out the ends come loose and unscrew easily. When you get yours unscrew the ends, clean the threads with alcohol, let dry and then add LocTite to the threaded studs and hand tighten as much as you can. This should prevent the ends from coming loose. This should be OK for occasional use.
customer_reviews.author: atlas

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive but good quality
customer_reviews.text: Really like this mallet as it was inexpensive and of decent quality. Bought this to use primarily on my AR-15 and it works just fine. Mallet is a tad bigger than I thought but not a huge issue. Has a very nice weight to it so it's neither too heavy or too light. The interchangeable/replaceable heads is a nice touch as well. Don't think I'll be needing to replace them any time soon but it's nice to know I have that ability. I saw several other similar mallets with multiple heads but I thought that might be a bit overkill for my needs. Overall, really nice multipurpose mallet.
customer_reviews.author: LouRevue

customer_reviews.title: They thread on and off easily. Both the male and female threads look strong ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hammer to beat on things with out damaging them. I Used it to remove and replace roll pins in my firearms. Most of the time I was hitting metal punches with it and some times u hit the pins themselves. The hammer has a heavy weight to it and the heads are replaceable. They thread on and off easily. Both the male and female threads look strong and clean. I have had no issues tightening them down and them staying in place while in use. The heads are soft and have not marred or left marks on anything I have used them on so far. I am happy with this purchase and will recommend it for others.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Really handy to have, a great value
customer_reviews.text: Wish I would have bought a hammer like this years ago. Super handy to have around for general use. I use it mostly for woodworking, but its also great for assembly and general tinkering. It doesn't leave a mark or damage the object you're working on unless you're really ignorant. So far the plastic end has held up pretty well after repeated banging. Seems to be better quality than the comparable Harbor Freight hammer. The screw on ends are a little loose and won't tighten down to my satisfaction, and the Tekton sticker peeled off easily, leaving sticky residue, but for the price, you can't beat it. Great tool to have around the garage.
customer_reviews.author: P. BrudererTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Small yet powerful mallet for tent stakes
customer_reviews.text: Very handy mallet for tent camping - small yet powerfully effective at driving tent stakes into the ground quickly. Because it is so small, can always find room to bring this handy mallet (unlike the larger types) so I never leave home without this mallet. It really makes setting up a tent go quickly before the sun sets and it gets dark. I lent mine out at the last Girl Scout outing and people loved it, so am buying another one. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps I got a lemon, but the translucent side fell off after just a a few pings. That led to the discovery that it doesn't really screw on to the head, as the receptor hole had no threads. The thing was apparently just glued in place with what looked like Super Glue. I was able to epoxy it on, but wouldn't waste my money on this.
customer_reviews.author: Stratman351

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick
customer_reviews.text: I needed something actually for the large flat lego plates, for my son and I while building. This seemed like something I could use for that, as well as other uses around the house when I need to hammer something but not damage it with the metal head of the hammer. I like that both ends unscrew, so I can replace as needed if they start to chip away or break, as these things usually end up doing over time. Bigger than I had expected, but that's fine since it works as I needed, and for a decent price.
customer_reviews.author: LegoDadTop Contributor: Architecture

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but. . .
customer_reviews.text: Nice hammer, but arrived in a used condition, and missing bits of chrome plating.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew H.

customer_reviews.title: It is a hammer. I hit things with it. The spatial relations of the things I hit change. I am happy.
customer_reviews.text: It's a simple striking tool. I strike things with it. Verily doth it smite and many things have I smote mightily with it. It's a very nice tool at a more than fair price. Barring the head flying off and smiting something I wished had remained unsmote, I can't see how this wouldn't last until the end of time.
customer_reviews.author: Biloxi Bay Bo

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: The hammer arrived defective. The heads are loose and fall off with a light tap. I have never been so disappointed in any item from amazon, and I have bought hundreds of items. I should have paid a little more for the nicer, made in USA one.
customer_reviews.author: ShadowRaven

customer_reviews.title: Meh...it hits stuff I guess.
customer_reviews.text: I love Tekton tools so when I saw this was the same garbage you buy in a TrueValue discount bin I was a little bummed. MIT own Tekton but the fit & finish/build quality of Tekton is excellent. They phoned it in on this one. Didn’t even have the grace to remove the original MIT sticker, just slapped a Tekton one on there too.
customer_reviews.author: christina22nn

customer_reviews.title: I swing and it works.....
customer_reviews.text: I use this to reload ammo using the Lee's Classic reloader. No issues and works just the way I want it to. I would recommend when hitting something on the plastic or rubber side. Don't be dumb and use it to nail in nails because it is not designed for that. Heads looks like they can be removed and replaced in time so that is a good option to have.
customer_reviews.author: ojustme

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: I would love to give a good review on the product but the only positive things I can say is I got it and it feels heavy. other then that I received a used damaged hammer right out of the package. The black plastic piece seems very cheap. I do not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Steinour

customer_reviews.title: Nice Piece of Hardware
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at the quality of this mallet for the price. I only gave it three stars for light weight because it weighs what it's supposed to. This is the perfect replacement for my Snap On mallet. I broke one of the heads on it and then discovered they aren't replaceable. The Tekton mallet heads are threaded on for easy replacement.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Kline

customer_reviews.title: Great value, light, rubber craft hammer!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the light woodworking that I'm doing! I had looked at the East wing wooden handled version at a brick and mortar and it's both twice the price of this but also the handle is so large and sturdy that almost seemed a bit cumbersome for the more delegate tapping I was going to be doing. This hammer works perfect for what I needed it to do!
customer_reviews.author: A. Brandt

customer_reviews.title: Handy little mallet
customer_reviews.text: Use this little mallet more than I expected to. Saw some reviews saying the rubber ends get “beat up” or “crack” if you use it for its intended purposes they’ll last. I’ve used it to install lifts on atv’s, a few chores around the house and to bang out a dent in my truck and it still looks brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Jake from State Farm

customer_reviews.title: Really great rubber hammer!
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a quality built hammer been needing one for a few years now and I’m sure it’ll be a valuable addition to anyone’s tool box, all it’ll need is a drop or two of loc-tite on the screws holding the plastic tips.. Give it an overall score of 5 because it well deserves it
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight tool
customer_reviews.text: It is surprisingly hard to find a smaller size mallet. Small hammers sure. I needed one with a rubber or nylon head for ammo reloading. This is perfect. I like that the heads are replaceable but I doubt ill ever need to. I may order a second just to have on hand 10yrs from now.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Well made - but not right for me
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a small, light weight mallet. I somehow thought this was smaller than a normal mallet (my fault for not measuring better). It seemed strong and well made. It was the same size as my regular mallet and much heavier so I returned it for full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne A

customer_reviews.title: Exactly The Same Product At A Way Lower Cost
customer_reviews.text: I own this same type of mallet which I bought on Amazon and paid at least twice as much for in the past. I took it to work and bought this cheap one to have in my house. It's exactly the same. The only difference is that with this one I had to screw in the two sides a bit. So, I saved maybe $10 for about ten seconds of work.
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Usefool tool to have...
customer_reviews.text: Nice little mallet. Good quality. Have already used it in a few different applications. Great weight, length and balance. Something everyone should have in their tool box and, in my honest opinion, a tool you will use more frequently than a hammer. I’ve used it to put together different kinds of snap together and peg shelving where using a hammer would be too rough in this application. I’ve also used the tool in a couple different home repairs already. The different colored sides offer differences in hardness to be used in multiple applications. Just a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Emilio

customer_reviews.title: Skip this one
customer_reviews.text: Give me a break. Both sides are hard as a rock and there is no reason that the two hammer heads unscrew. It's not like you're going to replace the heads when you can just buy the same hammer new for less than the two heads alone,. Just buy a cheap rubber mallet. They work just as good or better than this,. This is NOT soft.,It is SOLID and HARD
customer_reviews.author: Tony NYCTop Contributor: Health & Wellness

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sized mallet for bicycle maintenance
customer_reviews.text: I got this double-sided mallet to work on my bicycle and it has come in handy on several occasions already. Taking off and putting cranksets onto the bottom bracket require just a soft tap with a workshop towel between the mallet and the crank arm. The mallet appears well made with both heads spinning both on and off. The weight seems perfect for lighter duty soft blows. I'm sure I will find lots of other uses when a metal hammer is too heavy or harmful.
customer_reviews.author: Fishin' Fool

customer_reviews.title: Good and Affordable Mallet
customer_reviews.text: Great soft-end mallet to be used for average projects that need a gentle smack. The weight of the mallet is about right to hold it comfortably and to give the target area a good punch. The mallet it too small for hammering in large dowels, but fine for small ones or other metal parts that need to be put in their place. Great price too, if it stays down.
customer_reviews.author: MarioV73

customer_reviews.title: Great for setting concrete blocks
customer_reviews.text: I got this to pound on concrete blocks to position them without cracking and fracturing the blocks. It worked great the few times I have used it. It's nice to position the blocks on the mortar and just tap it whichever way to level and straighten it. Real handy, doesn't mar the work surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: 00xuser

customer_reviews.title: Good Small Soft-Headed Mallet
customer_reviews.text: This is a great soft headed hammer for hitting things you dont want to mark, or could break with a regular steel hammer. Note its not really a mallet, in the true sense, as the ads are normal hammer size, not the larger 2" size you get on rubber tent mallets. Its the same size as a regular hammer, and the black head is slightly harder than the red one, both can be removed and replaced with others.
customer_reviews.author: wattsie

customer_reviews.title: Great for mills and lathes
customer_reviews.text: Use this on my mill, welded a 16mm socket to one end for ease of removal of drawbar with a good dead blow on opposite side for knocking R8 collets out. Solid, just enough weight and I can choose between different density rubber heads in other side.
customer_reviews.author: Harley Buckskin

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for installing LVP
customer_reviews.text: Worked well. Used it to help install 900 square feet of luxury vinyl plank. Only thing was the faces kept unscrewing. I applied some loctite blue to the threads and didn't have a problem. It's still usable but if I had to install 1800 square feet, I'd probably need to change out the heads.
customer_reviews.author: Chris R.

customer_reviews.title: Great Mallet
customer_reviews.text: I just installed 1400 sq ft of Engineered Hardwood flooring. This mallet was just what I needed. Well built and light enough to keep from over pounding the flooring. It held together very well and you could replace the heads if you wanted. I did lots of pounding and still have plenty of life left. If you need a small rubber mallet this is the one to get.
customer_reviews.author: Zoey1231

customer_reviews.title: Great mallet for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Great mallet for the price. I was a little dissapointed in the size of the handle. Seems very small and thin when you are used to the tradition wood handle mallets. However being in the food industry we can not have wood handles on our tools so this fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: C Sauer

customer_reviews.title: useless
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for light guage jewelry wire (26g-18g) copper, brass & sterling which are all soft metals. Hoping to hammer/flatten lightly without scarring the metals. First it does nothing to the metals. Second, both plastic ends immediately gouged. I really dont know any legitimate use that wouldnt destroy the plastic ends. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: k m

customer_reviews.title: AR lower build
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a small hammer I lost while moving. For the price point this is perfect to assemble ar15 lowers. Both sides are fairly hard however, they are soft enough to use in roll pin punches. I'd highly reccomend if you are looking for a new hammer for your builds or about to start your first.
customer_reviews.author: Logan Akers

customer_reviews.title: The rubber end is also handy for checking knee reflexes
customer_reviews.text: Nice hammer. Im using it as part of my tool set for installing a vinyl floor. On a break, I was also able to use the rubber end to check my 10 year old's knee reflexes. It worked great, although I am pretty sure that is an "off label" application.
customer_reviews.author: See jay

customer_reviews.title: Quality  lightweight Rubber/Plastic mallet at a super cheap price! Buy It!
customer_reviews.text: Quality small light weight mallet hammer at a cheap price! Well worth the money. Good for plastic shelving, aluminum parts, and other soft metals or wood furniture. A great gift also. Buy it! i don't see how they make this at the price along with shipping. Rubber Plastic heads are great and the metal shaft and rubberized grip are good. Nice looking tool.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gerhardt

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I used this mallet to take apart my gaming chair, and it fell apart. Both ends cracked and unusable. This product is not sturdy at all. Really unfortunate end up tossing this after only a couple uses.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I have needed a rubber mallet on many occasions and finally ordered one. This one was perfect for my needs!! Fits in the hand well, not too heavy and not too light. Great addition to the tool box.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Lane

customer_reviews.title: You know you want it
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for gunsmithing and little tasks around the house that don't require a steel head hammer. Just the right size to fit in an ammo can or cleaning and gun maintenance kit. Heads unscrew so you can get different materials like brass or wood.
customer_reviews.author: AYonko

customer_reviews.title: For me this is a good mallet.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good mallet, but there is nothing soft about unless you compare it to a regular metal hammer. Having said that I really like this mallet and use it quite often. It has come in handy a number of times where a metal hammer wasn't the right tool for the job.
customer_reviews.author: Tony from Florida

customer_reviews.title: VERY WELL MADE N LOOKING TOOL AM VERY HAPPY
customer_reviews.text: 1st off i like to thank them for very fast shipping..even came on a sunday..i didnt even know usps ran on sundays..n the main thing i can say its built very well n looks very nice..i cant beleave how cheap it cost me for such a very well looking n made tool..i thought i was going to get some tool that would just do the job..i didnt think it would b near the quality that it is...thank you very much for the fast shipping n great well made looking tool..if ur looking for one trust me just buy it ur b very happy with it
customer_reviews.author: chad

customer_reviews.title: Packs power on both sides.
customer_reviews.text: I think for me, I really like how the weight is distributed with the hollow handle. Great to get a clean blow, especially in tight quareters. The black hard nylon handle feels like it carries the weight of a blow with stronger contact. If you are working on tacking or something fragile, you'll be using the red head for clear consistent striking. You cannot beat this price! Great overall mallet.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Feels like it will last forever...
customer_reviews.text: When I started building a guitar, I purchased a bunch of new tools for the random odd jobs. This is my favorite of the bunch. Feels super well built, love the different ends that you can use. I feel like it will last forever.
customer_reviews.author: John S.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: I love this mallet! Much better quality than I expected for the price. I bought it for jewelry making, but I have used it for several other projects as well! I'll probably order another one before long to keep in my household toolbox!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This works!
customer_reviews.text: I have a hinge on my bathroom door where the pin keeps working it’s way out of place and I need to continually hammer it back down. This small rubber mallet does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: JB Piper

customer_reviews.title: Rubber hammer
customer_reviews.text: This has come in handy so much since I bought it. Can't believe I went so long without a rubber hammer. I when I am putting stakes into the ground it is definitely my tool of choice. It doesn't damage my hammering if I am using a light metal that can bend.
customer_reviews.author: Val

customer_reviews.title: Not bad mallet
customer_reviews.text: This is actually a pretty good little mallet it's pretty sturdy, easy to hold, it's somewhat light, the only downside is that mine on the orange & black piece comes loose
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for the low cost - needed to reseat frets on a customer's electric guitar. Did not expect such excellent build quality. Later discovered they make fantastic quality ratchets, sockets, screwdrivers, etc. I'm on a long-term mission to replace all my low-quality tools with Tekton!
customer_reviews.author: Terry Moran Jr

customer_reviews.title: Nice Hammer
customer_reviews.text: I use this to work on my guns and it has worked perfectly. It is very sturdy and doesn't ding up my guns when I'm pounding in pins. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Dwight K. Schrute

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this mallet for my wife. She does ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mallet for my wife. She does all kinds of little crafts and was using a regular hammer, and kept getting imprints of the hammer on her work and on her fingers/thumbs. This is just the ticket. It's small enough to do semi-delicate work, yet heavy enough so you can just let the mallet do the work.
customer_reviews.author: Big C

customer_reviews.title: Good tool for a good price.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think I would even use this tool myself for my landscaping but I did and I love it. It is just perfectly made and the price is right too.
customer_reviews.author: Aduse

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: I expected it to be more flimsy or cheaper quality. This serves its purpose for what i need it. It is smaller than what i anticipated but its no big deal. Read the dimensions carefully. Overall the price point and the quality are okay.
customer_reviews.author: mlazareno

customer_reviews.title: It works. Great compact Size but with Good weight still.
customer_reviews.text: It’s good. Great price. I use it for building AR’s and it works well. The rubber heads work loose a little with moderate use no matter how you tighten them, but it hasn’t been an issue. Feels good in the hand and is fairly small and compact with enough weight still to pound any AR parts into submission.
customer_reviews.author: Chevy0846810

customer_reviews.title: Nice mallet for the money
customer_reviews.text: Nice mallet for the money. Used it to push some pins out of my AR15 when replacing my trigger. It's a nice addition to my gun toolbox.
customer_reviews.author: RADYOACTIVE

customer_reviews.title: Soft
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this for gun smithing. It's too soft. Both sides seem to be equally as soft. Glad I had a regular hammer. I'm sure I'll have a situation some day where this mallet will come in handy, just not today.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great firearm hammer
customer_reviews.text: Well made, nice hammer. Works great for hanging out firearm pins. Has excellent weight to it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Marsh

customer_reviews.title: Great for Laminte installation
customer_reviews.text: great for my laminate install. Only drawback is the rubber ends get loose overtime and hammering. You have to twist/tighten back up.
customer_reviews.author: RickM

customer_reviews.title: BUY BUY BUY
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t be happier with this. This has installed at least 4,000 sq ft+ of vinyl plank floor since I bought it November 1st. Highly highly recommend! Customer for life.
customer_reviews.author: Mary B.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, won’t stay together, heads damage easily
customer_reviews.text: Red head won’t stay connected. Won’t screw in tight to the mallet head, just spins and falls back off. Black side of the mallet is easily damaged and chipped, even with soft use. Recommend you shop elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: TrojanAurora

customer_reviews.title: No more regular hammer and a block of wood...
customer_reviews.text: I love the weight of the hammer and it delivers non-damaging strikes as I lay my flooring down. I am done with the regular hammer and a block of wood. The wood kept sliding over or flaking away as I beat it with a regular 17 oz. hammer. I'm so glad I gave that up and got a more appropriate striking tool. Thanks, Tekton!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: Every shop should have at least one, and if you don't own a dead-blow mallet, this is a great choice. Good quality and should last many years with proper use. The replaceable heads are a big plus. I have had zero problems with this mallet, would buy again, and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: cappy102

customer_reviews.title: Great for working with metals.
customer_reviews.text: Love the non maring surface. Great for working with precious metals and don't have to worry about finding in the yard after the dog stole it and used it for a chew toy!
customer_reviews.author: Percheron Girl

customer_reviews.title: WAAAY BETTER! DOES THE JOB AND WON'T DAMMAGE THE FINNISH
customer_reviews.text: NOT WHAT I WAS EXPECTING. DO NOT BUY THIS FOR COIN RING MAKING. THIS IS A CHEAP LITTLE RUBBER MALLET. IF THAT'S WHAT YOU NEED, GO FOR IT. I NEED HARD PLASTIC FOR STRIKING COINS AND THIS JUST BOUNCES OFF AND BREAKS APPART. I GOT THE HARBOUR FREIGHT TEAR DROP SHAPED NYLON HAMMER, WAAAY BETTER ! DOES THE JOB AND WON'T DAMMAGE THE FINNISH.
customer_reviews.author: donkeydon

customer_reviews.title: A Good Tool at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: This is a small rubber hammer with two types of rubber. The item should be stored dry to avoid rust; the handle is steel.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Breazeale

customer_reviews.title: Great product so far.
customer_reviews.text: Needed something to hammer grommets, and not damage or scratch them. This was perfect. Hard enough but not damage.
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: OK...
customer_reviews.text: Ok - made in China - Hard plastic on one side and hard rubber on other ? I think... - can unscrew either to replace. Using for gun pin removal and replacement...
customer_reviews.author: Larry D.

customer_reviews.title: SOLID MALLETT
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS A WELL BUILT, STURDY AND VERSATILE MALLET, IT REPLACED AN ANCIENT ONE AND WAS EXACTLY WHAT I WAS HOPING IT WOULD BE. HAS BEEN VERY EFFECTIVE AND EASY TO USE ON EVERY OCCASION I HAVE HAD TO USE IT, GOOD PRICE. I WAS VERY PLEASED WITH PURCHASE.
customer_reviews.author: Louis E. Delgado

customer_reviews.title: Skinny handle
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice mallet. The handle/grip is too small in diameter. It seems designed for someone with the hands of a 10 year old. If the grip was larger in diameter, I would have rated it higher.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Wow, what a hammer!
customer_reviews.text: Its a hammer. Not one for nails, but a decent hammer for woodworking. What else can you say about a hammer?
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointing quality for a Tekton product, but does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Quality not what I expected from Tekton based on other tools I own, but it works well and should serve me for years. The replaceable heads are a bonus as they are standard SAE threads and can easily be replaced in seconds as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Engineering Guy

customer_reviews.title: Good for hobbyist smith
customer_reviews.text: I use it for armorer work on AR rifles and it's about the right length and weight for the job..The heads are a little "soft" for some jobs, but won't mar the finish. It seems to be constructed well enough for the home-smith or hobbyist, but doubt it will hold up to everyday use in a shop.
customer_reviews.author: PawPaw

customer_reviews.title: It’s all in the wrist ⚒🧰👍🏻!!️
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful tool. Aesthetically pleasing and extremely well balanced. The universe sent it my way that I may hold on to all my fingers - holding it made me aware I’m not as uncoordinated as previously stated but that my working tools were very inadequate.
customer_reviews.author: miamiladybug

customer_reviews.title: Broke instantly.
customer_reviews.text: Broke during the very first job. Looks like the screw threads on the mallet head stripped on one side. It’s so cheap, I should have known. Otherwise seems like a good quality product. Not sure if I got a lemon?
customer_reviews.author: Alison Young

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Nice sturdy nylon hammer. Not a cheap knock off that will fall apart the first time you tap on a part. Well worth the price!.
customer_reviews.author: A fresh look

customer_reviews.title: Good mallet with plenty of striking force!
customer_reviews.text: I like the weight of this mallet but I wish that the striking surfaces were a little bigger in diameter. Still, I think it will work well for the purpose intended which was to use with a wood chisel set I had. Overall the quality seems good.
customer_reviews.author: JEFF COX

customer_reviews.title: Great mallet for price
customer_reviews.text: A very decent mallet. Works for most if not all applications. I've yet to run into an instance where it didn't do what I needed it to. The reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because the rubber tips are very hard compared to other mallets. I think that it may be too hard for some applications, b I would still recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Chace Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Too big for intended purposes.
customer_reviews.text: Tool is fine for some things, but too big and too heavy for the detail purpose I needed it for. Would appreciate better photos to show sizes of ALL items. There's no way to assess the size/proportion/scale of items in relation to other items ( human hand, ruler, coins, etc.).
customer_reviews.author: Mary L

customer_reviews.title: Hard plastic mallet, not soft
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made mallet but I wouldn’t call it soft. The plastic ends are very hard and its not a replacement for a true soft hammer or a dead blow. For general use, its more then adequate but again don't but it if you want a really soft mallet.
customer_reviews.author: Ian MazurskyTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I love this hammer. Its great for tough and delicate projects. Both head heads screw on and off light weight highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Nice little hammer
customer_reviews.text: If you need a smaller dead blow hammer, this one works fine. I was hoping for a little more weight, but I knew what I was buying and underestimated what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: A. Margis

customer_reviews.title: NON DESTRUCTIVE HAMMER
customer_reviews.text: WELL WEIGHTED, AND IDEAL FOR BEATING ON STUFF YOU DON'T WANT TO DAMAGE. REPLACEABLE ENDS ARE COOL, AND ITS IDEAL FOR GUNSMITHING WORK.
customer_reviews.author: B. Rousselle

customer_reviews.title: One side pops off
customer_reviews.text: One side of the hammer popped off before being used. The threading is buggered up and I'd have to use some sort of industrial glue to potentially hold it in place. Disappointing, but it wasn't terribly expensive.
customer_reviews.author: CBZ

customer_reviews.title: Little mallet does big jobs
customer_reviews.text: This little mallet definitely got it's work out over the time I have owned it. It is a great rubber mallet to building shelves, tap in screws, and lightly pound other items. I enjoy the sturdiness and dextrity of using this over a standard hammer. Recommend it to anyone looking for one.
customer_reviews.author: Jeomite

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive double headed mallet
customer_reviews.text: Not sure I would use the word "soft" in any description or review I wrote about this product. Both sides are "softer" than a steel hammer but are both rather rigid. Still usable for my purposes (gunsmithing) but with limits.
customer_reviews.author: G in SC

customer_reviews.title: Not great but not bad
customer_reviews.text: It’s ok, not that sturdy, kind of small in hand, but it can come in handy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great mallet
customer_reviews.text: Don't be dumb like me. The hammer faces are non marring. Nothing I hit with it has any marks. However, the side of the hammer head is still metal. While driving in a roll pin in my bolt catch I rubbed the side of the hammer head against my lower receiver and it scratched it. Tool is great, my usage was the issue. Just don't be dumb like me, the mallet is great.
customer_reviews.author: Harp

customer_reviews.title: perfect medium size for project
customer_reviews.text: This beats the cheaper black & yellow ones. Moderately larger, heavier and solid. My project heavier than sizing a ring. Worth it & less $ than home de po.
customer_reviews.author: Eors-tail

customer_reviews.title: Over two years of almost daily use.
customer_reviews.text: See picture to see how it has held up. For jewelry making, this is an excellent choice, enough weight to shape softer metals.
customer_reviews.author: This Guy

customer_reviews.title: Bent handle
customer_reviews.text: Handle was warped when it arrived. If I hold it straight, the mallet part leans alot to the side.
customer_reviews.author: Louisville502

customer_reviews.title: Hammer Time
customer_reviews.text: Nice mallet. Can’t be beat for the money. Great quality. A must have for every toolbox.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R

customer_reviews.title: Great hammer!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made hammer. We wished it had been a little smaller, but it is a great value!
customer_reviews.author: Beau

customer_reviews.title: Slick little persuader
customer_reviews.text: Great little mallet. I have a dead blow and several other "persuaders," but this is my go-to for anything small that requires finesse. It's a nice weight too and can get into tighter spaces than my dead blow. The soft and hard sides are very useful. Just buy it.
customer_reviews.author: BlockaWood

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Was surprised. Works great for what I wanted it for. Light work but with enough impact to make a difference.
customer_reviews.author: Richard W. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Works well for gunsmithing
customer_reviews.text: As the title states - this mallet works well for gunsmithing. No complaints at all.
customer_reviews.author: desert rat

customer_reviews.title: Great for laminate flooring installation
customer_reviews.text: This little hammer was perfect for installing laminate flooring. It was gentle on the laminate edging but had enough power to snap pieces in easily. Grip was comfortable and it’s nice the heads can be changed out.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Spore

customer_reviews.title: It’s a hammer
customer_reviews.text: Works well on those light jobs where a regular hammer would be overkill.
customer_reviews.author: Jostaff

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful little tool
customer_reviews.text: This little mallet worked great for installing about 700sq feet of LVP flooring.
customer_reviews.author: The beard of knowledge

customer_reviews.title: Nice craft/all around soft hammer,
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased with this purchase! This hammer looks and feels good in my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Halfpint

customer_reviews.title: Well made mallet
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mallet. Well made, sturdy and super fast shipping. We like it so much we bought 2!
customer_reviews.author: cul de sac pirate

customer_reviews.title: Good hammer
customer_reviews.text: Good little hammer. It could use a bit more weight, but it gets the job done without marking up your receivers or what not.
customer_reviews.author: Bob B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Hammer
customer_reviews.text: Nice hammer. Well made. Have gotten a lot of good use out of it. Great price and quick delivery!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Miklinski

product_meta.title: TEKTON 30812 Double-Faced Soft Mallet, 35 mm
product_meta.description: Color:Original VersionDesigned for safely installing small parts, assembling furniture and working with delicate materials and sensitive finishes, the TEKTON Double-Faced Soft Mallet (35 mm) is a master of friendly persuasion. Dual soft faces deliver the perfect strike while protecting parts and surfaces from damage. The lightweight, hollow tubular steel handle shifts the weight balance towards the head, increasing the force of each blow, especially in confined work spaces. Made of soft rubber, the cushioned handle grip offers the ultimate in non-slip comfort and control.
feature_bullets: Soft faces deliver a solid strike without damaging work surface
Lightweight tubular steel handle shifts the weight balance toward head for extra power in each blow
Extra soft, non-slip rubber handle grip for ultimate comfort and control
